A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I can't put enough words down to describe my disappointment with this film. It's bad when I go to see a deep highly  anticipated  film I've waited for 2 years to see\, and coming out asking yourself "so was that "The Last Jedi"? Or "Spaceballs 2"? 
Literally started out the first lines with a prank call demeaning the character I  refer  To as "Hitler Reincarnated" to the point where I will never care for his character again. Then they turn the most powerful Jedi master into a fat old angry farmer with no care for life. Then they force a rushed romance between two couples  down your throat so fast you won't know what hit you before they are smooching and having finger sex. 
Then they will made one couple irrelevant and the other meaningless. 
The last Jedi literally took every character involved and stripped away  what made them an interesting character in the first place. The big bad villain is dead Galway through the movie. And by the end of it the last Jedi dies and I literally do not have an ounce of remorse because that was not the  "Luke" I've known since I was a child. 
Don't get me wrong\, the acting was amazing! I am in love with Adam Driver and Daisy Ridley and their chemistry was great! 
But Rian Johnson needs to never direct a film again unless it's a comedy. I was cringing the entire way through the movie. 
I actually can't stand to watch it again. 
The last Jedi was aweful. 
If you can imagine watching a star wars film staring jar jar binks that was this film.
